fields.description:
It takes minutes until new pull requests are created and until they are merged.

!3731588682-2016-01-25_1607.png|thumbnail!

The process finishes after minutes... since today...\\
But some requests take so long, that I am not sure if they would be completed when I would wait longer. But however, I can't imagine that this long response time is normal.
fields.summary: Creating and merging pull requests takes forever

fields.description: Get notified when someone clone from a repository. Right now bitbucket got feature to get notified when someone commit/pull/fork/issue on repository under watch section
fields.summary: Get notification when a user clones a repository

fields.description:
Recently I did an atlassian-connect plugin for Bitbucket and found a bug when creating multiple issues asynchronously using the REST API.  The code was creating any number of issues asynchronously but some would intermittently fail due to trying to assign the issue with an id that was already present.

For example, I want to create three issues asynchronously and I currently have 10 issues in my repository I would get results similar to the following:\\
createdIssueIds = [12, 11, undefined] and the failure would be something like:

Cannot create issue as there is already an issue in the system with the id of 11.

Unfortunately I do not have screenshots or code that you can run it on as this was in a ShipIt and so I just changed the code to create issues one by one and it then began to work.

The API I was using is seen at [Bitbucket Issue REST API|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/issues%2BResource] and is the following endpoint:

POST https://api.bitbucket.org/1.0/repositories/{accountname}/{repo_slug}/issues  --data "title=value&content=value"
fields.summary: Race condition when creating multiple issues at once. (BB-15852)

fields.description: Can Bitbucket add "NewLisp" to the list of supported languages? Highlighting is the same as "Common Lisp" for the most part. Language home page is at http://www.newlisp.org/.
fields.summary: Add NewLisp to repository language options

fields.description:
Currently there is an internal API for this at\\
https://bitbucket.org/api/internal/repositories/{owner}/{repo_slug}/commits/statuses/{revision}

Can you please copy it to the external API?

Probably https://bitbucket.org/api/2.0/repositories/{owner}/{repo_slug}/commit/{revision}/statuses would be a better endpoint (more symmetrical to the existing endpoints).
fields.summary: Build statuses cannot be queried for a commit on API 2.0

fields.description:
h3. Team view (bitbucket.org/TEAM_NAME)
With the new projects feature, we cannot quickly see anymore when a repo was last updated. Please bring this back. Why would you even remove this? It's very useful information.

h3. Dashboard view (bitbucket.org/)
Even more insane, sorted alphabetically? Please also sort them on "Updated" date. If you need to find a repository by name, one can search for it.
fields.summary: Updated sort order removed from repository list view

fields.description:
Currently project pages are not much more than a list of links to the repositories within it. Instead, it would be better if one could have an editable markdown file that is displayed as the content of the project's page.

Furthermore, it would be nice if one could actually clone the project (as a repo) and receive that readme file along with the repositories within the project setup as submodules. This would also allow for the project repo to act as a place where a "do it all" build script could be placed.
fields.summary: Editable Project Pages

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

# Create a project in your team
# Add a repo to that project
# Transfer the repo from the team to an individual account
# Repo is still visible in project (owned by user), but also appears on the "Add repositories from an individual account" screen
fields.summary: Repo transferred from team to individual account not removed from team's project (BB-15647)

fields.description:
I was added to an empty repo (zero commits) and it had a bunch of issues. The owner has been unresponsive and I'd like to get taken off the repo.

This prevents me from using Bitbucket issue tracker because:

# I'm listed on issues that I cannot change to closed.
# I cannot unwatch the issues, they appear in my alerts as open.
# I have no way to remove myself from these issues or from the repo.

The repo is Samy Kamkar / unleak-main

Thank you,\\
Andrew Dubinsky
fields.summary: I'm stuck watching a dead repo

fields.description:
Great job with projects! However one feature that you can hopefully immediately add is the ability to treat a project just like a repo and have issues, wiki and downloads.

We have multiple websites that have multiple repos but have to select only one repo for the main repo to store issues, wiki, downloads etc... It would be so much easier to do this on the project level!

Thoughts?
fields.summary: Project-level Issues, Wiki, and Downloads (BB-15651)

fields.description:
Hi!

This user https://bitbucket.org/cherrypy/ had a different userpic before Butbucket's UI got updated. The current userpic belongs to another user; unfortunately I can't remember which one, but I've definitely seen it.
fields.summary: Wrong Userpic

fields.description:
I often take image snapshot which generates URL to the remote image (such as https://myimage.somesite.com).

If I insert this image, I get URL link so to see the actual image, a person has to click on the link.

On the other hand, to insert such image, I have to go to that remote site, save image, then upload it again as the local image.

Is there a way to implement a feature to pull image from the remote URL and embed it as image?

This is a usual feature on all forums. Check StackExchange sites for example.
fields.summary: Upload image from URL

fields.description:
As of the last update, it seems I and many others heavily relied on the last modified / recently updated repositories being at the top of the dashboard.

Now being sorted alphabetically makes it harder to go through recent projects.

Somewhat related: Issue BCLOUD-9620: mentions the option to change the sorting which has not been implemented in the recent changes.

Issue BCLOUD-6899 also mentions sorting on dashboard

Issue BCLOUD-12252 is about no longer having recently modified, and alphabetically sorting doesn't mention last modified.

Issue BCLOUD-12251 explains around the difficulty of finding recently modified repositories.

It seems sorting on the dashboard has been requested in places since early 2013, almost 3 years now.

Adding sorting options to the dashboard is likely to help a lot of people and address the fact some users prefer alphabetical and others prefer modified date.

h3. Update / 2016-01-29 / @benechols
We're working on an update that will allow you to sort by last modified and generally make the dashboard more flexible. I'll post updates here as I have them.

h3. Update / 2016-02-25 / @benechols
Today we shipped an update to the dashboard that restores the last updated column, and allows you to sort by any column you want. Your preference will be saved, so you won't have to re-sort whenever you return to the page. For more details, check out the blog post. Happy coding!
fields.summary: Sort Dashboard repositories by last modified / updated

fields.description:
I love the new projects feature to group repositories that is why I would like to propose the following enhancement.\\
Our repositories are shared between projects so it would be nice if a repository could belong to multiple projects.
fields.summary: Allow repositories to be in multiple projects (BB-15650)

fields.description:
I have multiple repositories on Bitbucket and lots of them had custom icons assigned. It seems that Bitbucket has recently introduced some concept of "projects". That's fine with me, but it removed all the icons from the repositories.

Please get all the custom icons I've uploaded and assigned to my repositories back.
fields.summary: All the repository icons got lost after the introduction of "projects"

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I've just noticed that all repos avatars are gone. I don't see even a way to set them back. Instead of them I see my default user avatar. What is going on?
fields.summary: All my repos avatars are gone

fields.description:
Open any project >> click settings >> click 'Save Project' button.

Project avatar will be removed, and the default avatar will replace it.

!2154410142-Screen%20Shot%202016-01-21%20at%202.08.01%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Clicking 'Save Project' on project settings page after making no changes wipes away the project avatar set. (BB-15635)

fields.description: This morning the dashboard was showing a list of repositories ordered by how recent each was modified. Now it seems to be ordered alphabetically and doesn't even show the last modified time on any of the repositories.
fields.summary: Dashboard no longer shows recently updated repositories

fields.description: It would be wonderful to be able to configure the main page to display recently changed repositories,  Currently the page shows recently viewed - completely useless for me.
fields.summary: Difficult to find recently changed repositories

fields.description:
The new project feature of bit bucket is cool. However, the first thing I noticed was that our repository icons are replaced with the project's icon.

My feature request is that repository icons override the project folder icon on the display. Otherwise I'm not sure where the repository icon even shows up now.

It looks like the repository icon is gone, and I'd love it back.\\
Thank you!

h3. Update / 2016-04-05 / @benechols
Repo avatars are back! Go to https://bitbucket.org/account/admin/features/ to turn them on.\\
We'll gradually roll them out to everyone, but you can turn them on today to see any custom avatars you set before and to set new ones.
fields.summary: Project Icon overrides Repository Icon - Cannot set Repository Icon

fields.description: The create branch flow expects to create a branch off of an existing branch.  If no branches are available, you can't create a branch but the UI doesn't make it clear what the problem is.
fields.summary: If a repository has no history, you can't create a branch through the UI (BB-15632)

fields.description:
Nothing happens if you click on the button - no popup to add, or change avatar.  Seems to only present itself if you are part of only a single team.  Only error in firebug that pops up is:\\
'uncaught exception: query function not defined for Select2 projects-owner-input'\\
!2154777696-Screen%20Shot%202016-01-21%20at%2010.58.38%20AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: 'Change Avatar' button on create new project dialogue box is broken if you are part of only a single team. (BB-15629)

fields.description:
If using Basic Authentication, trying creating a repo using REST API will end up with an error.

Creating repo with the REST API seems to work fine if using OAuth Authentication though.
fields.summary: Creating repository with API is not working if using Basic Authentication (BB-15624)

fields.description:
FIDO U2F is a secure and convenient method of two factor authentication.

GitHub already supports this, as does Google logins.

One of the most widely used security tokens, the Yubikey supports this.

Specifications can be downloaded here: https://fidoalliance.org/specifications/download/
fields.summary: Add support for FIDO U2F

fields.description: There should be a feature to sort and search (at least by the title) snippets in the snippets tab.
fields.summary: Add functionality for sorting and/or searching snippets (BB-15633)

fields.description:
When on the project commits page, if you navigate to the next page of commits, then go back and forward twice using the browser back/forward buttons, the build status icon is duplicated.\\
Steps to reproduce the issue:

# Go to project commits page (with build status icons)
# Go to the next page of commits
# Hit browser "Back"
# Hit browser "Forward"
# Hit browser "Back"
# Hit browser "Forward"

See screen shot below:\\
!2971292560-Screen%20Shot%202016-01-20%20at%204.30.24%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Duplicate build status icons are created on commits page if using browser nav buttons. (BB-15618)

fields.description: After installing the AWS  codeDeploy add-on, I'm not able to see the codeDeploy settings in the repository settings. additionally the repo is under team. I asked the admin to check if he can see the codeDeploy settings but unfortunately even he was not able to access it.
fields.summary: AWS codeDeploy add-on issue

fields.description:
Related to BCLOUD-6645, but for the API.

I'm using your API (v2) to build a status board for all of the PRs that our team has open across a handful of repositories.

This works nicely, and I can show a good amount of information directly on the status board. However, for PRs with source conflicts, I'd like to show that directly on the status board so that the author can see it needs attention, and reviewers can know to wait until later.

(I'm using Mercurial, in case that makes a difference.)
fields.summary: Feature request: allow access to pull request conflict status via API

fields.description: https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/event-payloads-740262817.html#EventPayloads-Push says the type of a git change can be "branch, tag, or annotated_tag". But when pushing an annotated tag the type sent in the payload is "tag", not "annotated_tag". Either there is a bug in the payload generation, or the documentation could use some clarification.
fields.summary: The repo:push Webhook says tag when it should say annotated_tag (BB-15853)

fields.description:
I just activate the issue tracker within one of my repositories. I also entered issues successfully. However, when I commited new code to the repository fixing a bug the corresponding issue gets resolved but in the commits list there is no cross reference to the bug as explained here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/resolve-issues-automatically-when-users-push-code-221451126.html|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/resolve-issues-automatically-when-users-push-code-221451126.html]

See the image for more details: !2148146197-image.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Cross Reference between Commits and Issues

fields.description:
I am facing the following issue:\\
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly\\
fatal: early EOF\\
fatal: index-pack failed.\\
I tried to clone with SSH over https.But while cloning through ssh it is saying could not read from repository.Kindly help me with this.
fields.summary: Unable to clone repo using Git

fields.description:
Some developers may work on their own private branches and constantly push changes to them. So commit notification emails are just spam to them and nothing else.

If users can filter notification emails based on branches, it would be great; the notification emails will more relevant and will help avoid spam.

This can be as easy as adding regex for notification emails, just like it is done for preventing deletion of branches or rebases.

Something simple like:\\
notification emails only for:\\
master\\
release-branch-*

will work great.
fields.summary: Filter commit notification emails based on branches

fields.description: There is a current bug that currently does not show symlink'd images in repos. This seems to happen with any file with an image-link extension
fields.summary: Symlinks of images do not show in repository (BB-15601)

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
When the Bitbucket Issue tracker contains a lot of Issues, the Export process (the creation of the ZIP file) can take quite some time. The user doesn't know how long it may take for the process to finish.

h3. Suggested Solution
When the user selects 'Start export' a popup shows with a progress bar. Show below the progress bar approximately how much time is required for the process to finish.
fields.summary: As a user I want to see how much time the Export issues process will take to finish in Bitbucket Issue tracker

So suddenly the master branch disappear,

!2459472837-Screenshot%20from%202016-01-18%2012-40-03.png|thumbnail!

and all the commits/branches got messed up:

!976614810-Screenshot%20from%202016-01-18%2012-52-47.png|thumbnail!

so what's happening?

fields.description:
*expect*

Commentter profile should have resolution equal reporter profile
fields.summary: Avatars on comments made to issues show as a lower resolution than the reporter avatar. (BB-15848)

fields.description: For brand new Repository, I can't create branch, even the branch name entered, but the create button keeps disable. Can't save..... Need help asap

fields.description:
After I delete a private repository with name xyz, and then try to re-create repository with the same name, got error: "The repository name exist " , also some times I still see the deleted repository name in the repositories list, once click on it, got message saying it has been deleted......

How to fix?
fields.summary: After delete a repository, can't create the repository with the same name

fields.description:
I'm using "Stash" at work and for pull requests the "File Changed" is a sidebar on the left side with a tree view file structure.

It seems the current version removed this tree view. In favor of just a list of file paths.

I feel really uncomfortable with this design. I need to see the files in their intended tree structure to better understand the changes to the repository. Also, the previous view would color the file names in the tree based on the "modified, renamed, deleted" etc, whereas this view is less clear. For example index-base.html, the entire file was added but I'm supposed to understand that based on line additions  (+91, -0). Please bring back the tree view and coloring of the file-name for easier overview.

At least make this configurable please.

!254673323-Screen%20Shot%202016-01-17%20at%203.11.20%20PM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Bitbucket Server tree diff view in Bitbucket Cloud (BB-12051)

fields.description:
I am creating an extension for bitbucket pull requests and I am having trouble developing a logout functionality for the user.

It would be extremely helpful to have an API endpoint to allow users to logout or revoke access to the extension.

The logout would simply invalidate the access token and require the user to log back in again.
fields.summary: Add API End point to allow user logout

fields.description: Hi guys. i just started to use bitbucket. When i try to clone git repository, i got this message. I set sslVerify to "false". What could be the problem ?
fields.summary: Can not clone git repository

fields.description: Hello, I tried to do an import from GitHub and it looks like it is stuck in the queue forever. Can you help me in resolving this issue?
fields.summary: Import stuck in queue
Comments don't parse URL properly

fields.description: Can it be made possible so that each individual wiki page can be made public or hidden and possible to give access to people to only edit specific pages.
fields.summary: Page-level permissions for wiki pages

fields.description: A very simple improvement would be to email notify a user when an invalid authentication attempt is made to a user's account. This could help diagnose and identify invalid user attempts and allow your users to take appropriate action.
fields.summary: Notify a user when an invalid authentication attempt happens

fields.description:
Can't unwatch issue using below link.

https://bitbucket.org/api/1.0/repositories/site/master/issue/2874/unwatch/DanielFitzgerald/e869c5896505e1f638fb7ea42855e81d04e5a134/

fields.description:
If you try to link issues within the wiki using Creole, for example:

<<issues milestone=2.0.0&status=open&status=new&status=on+hold>>

The issues will list, but there will be issues that are not linked if there are any special extended latin characters (umlauts, swedish Ø, etc)
fields.summary: Issue search in wiki will not link if there are special characters (umlauts, etc) (BB-15544)

fields.description:
If you comment on a pull request with a commit SHA (i.e. This fixes commit ab3df4a), the relative link will be a non-valid URL back to the repo:

account/repo/commit/SHA
fields.summary: Pull request commit comments show incorrect relative link (BB-15540)

fields.description:
I deleted a repository, but for some reason it is still showing up on my list of repositories and when I click on it, it states “Repository unavailable”. I would like this completed deleted. How can I do that with the repository being unavailable?

The repository is: https://bitbucket.org/dyoder/cs3201versioncontrol.
fields.summary: Deleted repository showing as repository unavailable

fields.description: I feel we are missing a key piece of the issue work flow, knowing if the issue is being worked on or not.
fields.summary: Add "Working" or "In progress" status to issues

fields.description:
Trying to log in from your new shiny login page using Google account results an Session expired error (on page https://bitbucket.org/social/google/setup/)

This breaks OAuth 1.0 login flow before [step 3|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/oauth-on-bitbucket-cloud-238027431.html#OAuthonBitbucketCloud-OAuth1.0]. I hope this will be fixed soon. For the reference, mobile friendly login page was requested already back in 2013 in issue BCLOUD-7744.
fields.summary: Google login broken on new login page

fields.description: I'm on latest Ubuntu/Firefox
fields.summary: Commit descriptions are not aligned with the graphical tree (BB-15553)

fields.description:
Left bracket shows and hides the sidebar (which is nice!). However, it doesn't check for modifier keys and the shortcut "cmd+[" is used by Safari for back navigation. Thus when you navigate back it pops the side bar open and then loads the previous page (closing the sidebar). Super annoying.

See support article: https://support.atlassian.com/servicedesk/customer/portal/11/BBS-26270
fields.summary: Cmd+Left bracket has unintended side effects. (BB-15847)
Team Avatar is not updated if the team name is numeric.

fields.description: The current timeout of 10 seconds isn't long enough for very large repos.  For instance, those users who are using bitbucket to deploy files to websites and need it to accurately determine if a timeout has actually occurred.
fields.summary: Increase the webhook timeout period, or allow users to set their own timeout period.

fields.description:
Hi, the repository currently has 4 users.

When I try adding another person to this repo, I get following error message.

Not enough users on plan. The owner of this repository (-------) will need to upgrade their plan before this action can be completed.

The following steps were taken which created this issue.

# Sent invitation to a user.
# There was a delay (for about 10 minutes for the invitation mail to be sent) on invitation.
# Mistaking the delay as a bug, I've canceled pending invitation in order to resend.
# Tried to resend invitation.
# Got the following error message. "Not enough users on plan. The owner of this repository (-------) will need to upgrade their plan before this action can be completed. "
# Waited 24 hours.
# Tried sending the invitation again.
# Still the same error message.

I've attached a screen shot of the error message on this issue.

Thanks in advance.
fields.summary: Cannot Add more users.

fields.description:
The new PR List 2.0 beta feature can be enabled in your [Bitbucket settings|https://bitbucket.org/account/admin/features/].

Please leave all feedback for the beta feature here.
fields.summary: Pull Request List 2.0 Feedback

fields.description:
There doesn't seem to be a way to change the device used for 2FA.

The workaround is to disable and re-enable 2FA with the new device which seems odd.
fields.summary: Provide way to change the device for 2FA

fields.description: I have an email address assigned to me by my company:  yongke_yu_bill@bitbucket.org .  The problem is I can't confirm this email address because I can't receive any email for that address.  How do I confirm this email address?
fields.summary: How do I confirm email in @bitbucket.org domain?

fields.description:
Since last two days, I am unable to push anything to my bitbucket account. Previously it was working.

Please assist to get this resolved.
fields.summary: unable to access

fields.description:
Currently, any admin can add/remove another admin with no verification. This can cause some security issues in case the account to be hacked.

It would be nice if we could add some kind of code verification to add before add/remove any admin/owner from a repo. All administrators from an account should be redirected to some kind of link where they should add some special code that is generated when an admin account is created/added on BB.
fields.summary: Verification Code before add/remove an admin from Bitbucket account

fields.description:
Bitbucket should check if similar builds are linked in pull requests before determine whether the pull request failed or not.

Currently, all builds linked are treated as unique build hence if for example 4 similar builds linked(different build number) and only the latest build is green, the pull request is still marked as failed.
fields.summary: Bitbucket should check if similar builds are linked in pull requests (BB-15490)

fields.description:
Today I just logon and found a new repository which was recently updated.\\
But I can't remember when I've add this repository and I don't use the Drupal in my practice.\\
And last commit has been pushed on 2016-01-05 yesterday I had no time for coding at all so\\
it looks like some strange bug for me.\\
I've already changed the password btw.\\
Regards Eugene.
fields.summary: Somehow I own a new unknown repository

fields.description:
At the moment builds are also triggered via Webhook when tags are pushed. There is only one common option to configure this - no filtering here possible. This is rather annoying when working with tags. We use auto tags for certain build stages - and the pushing of those triggers again a build without any changes in the sources.\\
As workaround one could use a 'gate keeper' stage which checks if files have been changed - but this is rather inconvenient...
fields.summary: Feature: Trigger build only on file changes

fields.description:
I am new to version control. i have created versions in my bitbucket account. and created branches. through source tree i am able to upload files into brances. but how can i manage versions? i mean how can i know this is version0.1, this is version0.2 etc.,

How to connect my client host and automatic uploads using bitbucket?
fields.summary: version control

fields.description:
Hi,\\
my last commit doesn't deploy on ftploy, i have tried many times and no sucess, is there any logfil where i can see what is gonig wrong ?
fields.summary: ftploy dosen't deploy my last commit

fields.description:
I created my account yesterday.\\
I was able to login, checkout a project from a friend's repository, etc\\
despite the fact that I forgot to confirm my email.\\
I was asked to confirm my email only when I tried to report this issue.
fields.summary: Email confirmation should be mandatory for account creation

fields.description:
I tried to use the following regex {{(?<=\s|\b)((SG|DOC|SGN)-\d+)(?=\s*)}} as a custom Link for my bitbucket project, but I get this error {{The key must be a valid regular expression}}.

I don't see any reason why it is an invalid regex.
fields.summary: Custom Links regex invalid

fields.description:
Could not log in with lynx www browser because of the forced use of referrer\\
http header.

Please, don't make referrer header mandatory.
fields.summary: lynx, login and http referer mandatory

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to update and post new comments through the Bitbucket API, similar to what github provides: https://developer.github.com/v3/pulls/comments/#create-a-comment

Currently the documentation specifies a way to retrieve comments, but no update, delete or create functionality.  That prevents the creation of any rich 3rd party integrations around pull requests.
fields.summary: Update Comments through the Bitbucket API

fields.description:
There is currently no way of authenticating webhooks. While IP whitelisting could work, it is fragile and cumbersome to maintain a list of allowed IP addresses (even if said list is available through an API).

A simple & proven way of authenticating any kind of payload is to join an HMAC signature with the payload.

All is required is a shared secret between Bitbucket and the webhook receiver. We should be able to provide said secret on the webhook configuration page (and the API). Then, Bitbucket sends the webhook with the computed HMAC (in a header or within the payload) so that the receiver can check it.

Please note that this feature is [already implemented by Github|https://developer.github.com/webhooks/securing/].
fields.summary: Webhook HMAC signature (security issue)

fields.description:
Let's say I have a README.md and I'd like to create a link to a file that contains spaces in its name, file with spaces.md. I'd like to be able to jump to the file's source code.

{code}
/
 -- README.md
 -- File with spaces.md
{code}

After inspecting the element in the browser, I figured out what the href should be (changed it manually, then clicking on it brought me to the page I want to reach):

{code}
<a href="username/repository/src/c0mm1th4sH/File%20with%20%spaces.md">
{code}

Unfortunately I couldn't accomplish that. Some of the things I have tried so far:

{code}
[Link](File with spaces.md)
[Link](File%20with%20spaces.md)
[Link](File\ with\ spaces.md)
[Link]("File with spaces.md")
{code}

It results in the following HTML in Bitbucket:

{code}
<a href="/username/repository/src/c0mm1th4sH/File%2520with%2520spaces.md">
<a href="/username/repository/src/c0mm1th4sH/File%2520with%2520spaces.md">
<a href="/username/repository/src/c0mm1th4sH/File%5C%2520with%5C%2520spaces.md">
<a href="" title="File with spaces.md">
{code}

You can play with the [example repository|https://bitbucket.org/vargavince91/space-markdown] I created.

[Stack Overflow|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34569256/link-to-filenames-with-spaces-in-bitbucket-markdown%3Fnoredirect%3D1#comment56883699_34569256]

See [comment|http://stackoverflow.com/questions/34569256/link-to-filenames-with-spaces-in-bitbucket-markdown%3Fnoredirect%3D1#comment56883699_34569256]:

bq. Appears to be a tremendous amount of variation in how implementations [render|http://johnmacfarlane.net/babelmark2/%3Ftext%3D%255BLink%255D%28File%2Bwith%2Bspaces.md%29%250A%255BLink%255D%28File%252520with%252520spaces.md%29%250A%255BLink%255D%28File%255C%2Bwith%255C%2Bspaces.md%29%250A%255BLink%255D%28%2522File%2Bwith%2Bspaces.md%2522%29%250A] _(updated Waylan's link)_ those. However, your second example seems to work most consistently. If that doesn't work, then I would report it as a bug. – Waylan
fields.summary: Link to filenames with spaces in Bitbucket Markdown (BB-15884)

fields.description: I have two different branches that have stopped firing the webhooks on push. If I manually run the trigger from quay.io it works, but for some reason the trigger isn't firing on its own.
fields.summary: Push webhooks not firing

fields.description:
I have a repository for testing relative-link syntax @ https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test with a wiki @ https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test/wiki/Home . The filetree of the project (which includes its wiki) is

{code}
rst_link_test/README.rst
rst_link_test/file_in_project_root.txt
rst_link_test/images/Jen_Sorensen_PandP-poster-ForWeb.png
rst_link_test/subdir_level_1/file_in_folder_just_below_project_root.rst
rst_link_test/wiki/another_wikipage_in_top-level_folder.rst
rst_link_test/wiki/Home.rst
rst_link_test/wiki/subdir_level_2/wikipage_in_child_folder.rst
{code}

As shown @ [rst_link_test/wiki/Home.rst|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test/wiki/Home]

# [Home>ordinary file|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test/wiki/Home#rst-header-currently-working-style]: I can successfully link from {{rst_link_test/wiki/Home}} to an ordinary file in the project's {{./subdir_level_1/}} with {{../src/HEAD/subdir_level_1/file_in_folder_just_below_project_root.rst}}
# [Home>image>downloads|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test/wiki/Home#rst-header-id28]: I can successfully {link to, display} an image in the [parent project's Downloads|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test/downloads] from {{rst_link_test/wiki/Home}} with {{../downloads/Jen_Sorensen_PandP-poster-ForWeb.png}}
# [README>image>in project repo|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test/overview#rst-header-in-project-repo]: several syntaxes work to allow this project's {{README}} to display a file in its {{./images/}}
# [Home>image>ordinary file|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test/wiki/Home#rst-header-in-project-repo]: I *cannot* successfully {link to, display} an image in the project's {{./images/}} from {{rst_link_test/wiki/Home}} with {{../src/HEAD/images/Jen_Sorensen_PandP-poster-ForWeb.png}} . In fact, I can't find _any_ syntax that will allow a relative link from {{rst_link_test/wiki/Home}} to an image in {{rst_link_test/images/}} .

But

# Both {{rst_link_test/subdir_level_1/}} and {{rst_link_test/images/}} are obviously peer directories/folders.
# {{rst_link_test/wiki/Home}} _can_ display an image from its [parent project's Downloads|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/rst_link_test/downloads], so it's not like the wiki cannot display images outside its own pseudo-project.

So I assert that either (and this is a boolean {{or}})

# The same relative-link syntax that works _from_ a wiki file _to_ an ordinary file in the wiki's parent project should work for image display.
# BB should enable _some_ relative-link syntax to allow a wiki file to display an image in the wiki's parent project.
fields.summary: relative linking from project wiki to project: link to ordinary file works, link to image fails

fields.description:
The documented examples do not work for RST code highlighting.\\
The <code> tool in the editor creates a

{code}
#!restructuredText

 .. sourcecode :: python 
  block 

{code}

and that does not render with any highlighting at all.\\
There are questions on the board with users reporting the same for C as well as Python so this appears to be more than just one language.

To Reproduce:

Start a new wiki page, set it as a restructuredText markup, insert a code block, either from the example our using the tool. Click "view" and watch it NOT highlight. Click save and watch it render without highlighting.

Bug is seen by other Atlassian Employee: @aahmed\\
https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/BSERV-8263
fields.summary: syntax highlighting for wiki's with RestructuredText does not work (BB-15599)

Please help!!!

fields.description:
Hello

I've faced issue with accessing to my repositories from ZeroLag servers. It works fine on my local computer. And also ZeroLag support said that they added new IPs to whitelist [What are the Bitbucket Cloud IP addresses I should use to configure my corporate firewall|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/what-are-the-bitbucket-cloud-ip-addresses-i-should-use-to-configure-my-corporate-firewall-343343385.html] When I try to pull I get the following output:

{code}
#!shell

ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Connection timed out
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
{code}

{code}

ssh -Tvvv git@bitbucket.org

debug1: connect to address 104.192.143.2 port 22: Connection timed out
debug1: Connecting to bitbucket.org [104.192.143.3] port 22.
{code}

By the way I can access to site over https (check the output)

{code}
#!shell

curl -i https://bitbucket.org

{code}

Here is tracerout output

{code}

traceroute to 104.192.143.2 (104.192.143.2), 30 hops max, 60 byte packets

16  * * *
17  * * *

Could you help?

fields.description:
[Projects|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/projects-792497956.html] are groups of or folders for repositories, which are currently implemented only [for teams|BCLOUD-2323].

# User needs to create a team with only her/himself as member. Call this a "proxy account," since this "team" will have only one member, and exists only to provide functionality to formerly-user repos.
# User must [manually transfer|BCLOUD-12167] each of their repos from their own/user account to their proxy/team account. Note that users who are most likely to be interested in Projects are users with ... wait for it ... lots of repos.
# Once a repo is transferred from a user account to her/his proxy/team account, the user effectively has [2 identities|BCLOUD-2323]: "if [OP] follows a link to my user [account] (like the [ones in Issue comments]) they [won't] see my repositories. [OP] would have to know to look under [my user account>Teams]." If the user also belongs to real/non-proxy teams, the OP will need to "figure out which team I am using as a user-specific team."
# Transferring a repo from user to team [requires changing the repo URI|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/change-or-transfer-repository-ownership-289964397.html], which means the user must [change any links to the repo in any documentation|BCLOUD-2323]. This is a _huge_ hit for users who document their code for OP, and the hurt scales with number of repos to transfer.

Hence I request that Projects (repo folders) be made available for user accounts (not just team accounts), thus obviating the need to transfer repos to purely-proxy teams.

h3. 2016-01-23 edit by @dbennett
I'm going to remove labels from the description and title. We've already had problems mingling the two features on the initial request and there's no need for a pro-active complaint about something that's not even in design. For those interested in labels take a look at issue BCLOUD-11800 and comment / vote there if you'd like to influence the direction.
fields.summary: repository Projects/folders for users (not just teams) (BB-15428)

fields.description:
On one of our branches we opened a pull request, later renamed and removed the branch. I wanted to change the pull request to use the new branch, but the branches dropdown is empty. Since it is not possible to remove pull requests, this pull request is floating around without a purpose.

It would be great if this PR can be removed, but it is most certainly a bug that the dropdown doesn't load.
fields.summary: Cannot delete PR after deleting branch (BB-15402)

fields.description:

The search field will automatically default to one of the choices, but you cannot choose which one.  If the wrong user is defaulted to, then you will receive the following error:\\
{"error": {"message": "write or admin access required: user_name"}}

fields.description:
When you create a repository in Bitbucket, you can select the "Language". Chapel is language that has been around for around a half a decade and is gaining popularity. However, it is not in the list of selections. Please add it and support it.

For more information, see their [website|http://chapel.cray.com/] and [GitHub page|https://github.com/chapel-lang/chapel]

Thanks,

Ben
fields.summary: Add Chapel to supported languages list (BB-15429)

"Error"\\
"We were unable to load this page."

!4262335981-Screen%20Shot%202015-12-22%20at%2011.07.24%20AM.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: PR content not shown for select Mercurial repositories. (BB-15389)

fields.description:
Is it possible to add easier navigation between versions when viewing a diff/

Currently going back/forward a diff requires:

# Click From dropdown
# Wait for it to populate
# Find/scroll to the currently selected commit
# Click the item below it
# Wait for diff to reload
# Click the To dropdown
# Wait for it to populate
# Find/scroll to the currently selected commit
# Click the item below it
# Wait for diff to reload

Similar workflow applies to browsing the source

# Click From dropdown
# Wait for it to populate
# Find/scroll to the currently selected commit
# Click the item below it
# Wait for source to reload

Even using the History view is:

# Press back
# Wait for full page load
# Remember the item you last clicked
# Click item above/below it
# Wait for full page load

This is further confused by the History missing out some commits presumably minor ones.\\
e.g. The copyright year change in:\\
https://bitbucket.org/earlsoft/livemedia/history-node/7f0bd5289ef1/BasicUsageEnvironment/BasicHashTable.cpp?at=default

Next/previous diff(s) would massively simplify this to:

# Click Next/Previous diff/version
# Wait for diff/source to reload

I'm aware that you've said in BCLOUD-8333 that similar is prohibitive but hopefully that's less of an issue now.

Thank for your consideration
fields.summary: Easier navigation between diffs (BB-15430)

fields.description: Issue [BB-15376|BCLOUD-3506] is not resolved, please re-open it. It's a feature that me, my colleagues and (obviously) a whole lot of other users needs.
fields.summary: Re-open BB-15376

fields.description:
Recent activities are personal stuffs. Would you please add option to let the author choose which ones should be shown and which ones not?

They are really personal information. I don't want everyone to know at which time of the day I commit the code, or comment on an issue. I don't want people to know which projects I'm working on.

All major social networks such as Google+, Facebook... allow users to choose which activities to be shown on their profiles.

Please consider adding that option. I don't want to make my profile private, but I _do_ want to manage my recent activities.

Thank you.
fields.summary: Please add option to manage content of Recent Acitvities (BB-15431)

fields.description:
I'd like to be able to put a link in the online version of the hgbook 'edit this paragraph' and let people edit directly on Bitbucket. This would require being able to link to a paragraph in a file with editing enabled.

It's already possible without editing: https://bitbucket.org/Mathiasdm/hgbook/src/dc74e6fdd29a61c7637ef0ce6d1fe869997bbacb/en/intro.rst?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#rst-header-a-few-of-the-advantages-of-distributed-revision-control
fields.summary: Link to a repository file paragraph with editing enabled (BB-15432)

fields.description:
Hello,

I use the command specified in your website to create a repo so to work with an existing project on my harddisk, but get this error.

~/myproject   git push -u origin --all\\
*fatal: bad numeric config value '5242880000' for 'http.postbuffer': out of range*

What can I do?
fields.summary: fatal: bad numeric config value '5242880000' for 'http.postbuffer': out of range

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
If a Bitbucket user wants to sync a fork of their repo, they have to do it manually.

h3. Suggested Solution
Offer an option to Bitbucket users to enable (or disable) automatic syncing of forks with their original repo.
fields.summary: As a repo admin I want to enable automatic fork syncing for my forks so that I won't have to manually sync them (BB-15433)

fields.description: I tend to get lost in bigger pull requests (e.g. refactoring stuff) and don't always have the time to work through the complete requests before getting interrupted. It would be nice to have the option to mark single files as "approved". So when you are coming back to the PR you know what you already worked through.
fields.summary: Make it possible to approve single files in pull requests
Header rendering code tag with normal font size (BB-15434)

fields.description:
I have a [personal account|https://bitbucket.org/tlroche/] which I've used for awhile (|repos| > 50). I have not needed Team functionality, but recently created [a team|https://bitbucket.org/theteamthatistom/] (of which I am the sole member and admin) to access [Project functionality|https://confluence.atlassian.com/bitbucket/projects-792497956.html]. (I suspect I'm not alone in this usecase.)

I note your quick resolution to the FR to [enable bulk addition of team-owned repositories to a project|BCLOUD-12166]. Unfortunately for folks in my (and, again, I suspect many others) case, this is useless until we have team-owned repos. Hence I request the ability to bulk-transfer repos from my personal account to my team account. Please enable! either via API or web UI.
fields.summary: bulk-transfer repos from personal account to team

fields.description: When you create a new, empty project you can add repos to them in bulk, but you can't do the same after there are repos already in the project. This would be a useful feature though.
fields.summary: Be able to add repos to a project in bulk even after having repos in the project
